English: TYNWALD
ST JOHN’S 29th MAY, 1905.
ABSTRACT
OF
ACT  FOR PROMULGATION.
Brown And Sons, Ltd, Printers, Douglas.
THE HIGHWAYS (MOTOR CAR) ACT, 1905.
Manx: SLATTYS RAADYN VOOAREY (GREIE GLEASHAGHEY), NUY CHEEAD YEIG AS QUEIG (1905).

English: This Act is to provide authorization of races with motor cars.
Manx: TA’N Slattys shoh kiarail rolaue dy chur pooar son raceyn lesh greinyn gleashaghey.

English: Section 3 enacts that the Highway Board may, upon application, by order, declare that any public road may be used for races with motor cars furing the whole, or part of any day or days, not ecxeeding six in the year. — (Sub-section 1.)
Manx: Ta ayrn trass oardrail dy vod Boayrd y Raad Vooar, er hirrey, liorish oardyr, hoilshaghey magh dy vod raad mooar erbee ymmyd ve jeant jeh son raceyn lesh greinyn gleashaghey ooilley, ny ayrn, jeh laa ny laaghyn, nagh bee ny smoo ny shey ayns y vlein.

English: Order to contain provisions as to suspension of other traffic, and for restriction of speed in populous places — (Sub-section 2.)
Manx: Oardyr dy cummal kiarailyn mychione cumrail jeh marchanys elley, as lheittal yn siyr ayns boaylyn ta lane dy cummultee,

English: Board may require deposit to defray cost of such order.— (Section 4.)
Manx: Foddee yn Boayrd shirrey gioal dy eeck yn sheeagh jeh yn argid baarit jeh’n oardyr.

English: The powers of the Board under this Act are exercisable for one year only after the promulgation of the Act, unless the Tynwald Court, by resolution, expressly authorize the further exercise of the same.— (Section 5.)
Manx: Ta pooaraghyn jeh yn Boayrd fo yn Slattys shoh dy ve fo currym son un blein ynrican lurg hoilshaghey magh jeh yn Slattys, mannagh jean Quaiyl y Tynwald, liorish aigney mie, dy hraastey chur phooar phooar sodjey jeh’n lheid shen.

English: The Royal assent to this Act was given by His Majesty in Council, at Buckingham Palace, on the 10th day of May, 1905.
Manx: Va’n coardail Reeoil gys y Slattys shoh currit Liorish E Ard Ooashley ayns Coonseil, ec y Quaiyl ec y  Plaase Buckingham, er y jeihoo laa jeh’n queigoo vee jeh yn vlein, nuy cheead yeig as queig (1905).

English: TYNWALD
ST JOHN’S 5th JULY, 1905.
ABSTRACT
OF
ACT  FOR PROMULGATION.
Brown And Sons, Ltd, Printers, Douglas.
THE PETTY SESSIONS AND SUMMARY JURISDICTIONS ACT, 1905.
Manx: SLATTYS NY WHAIYLYN BEGGEY AS BRIWNYS GIARE NUY CHEEAD YEIG AS QUEIG (1905).

English: An Act to amend the Petty Sessions and Summary Jurisdiction Acts.
Manx: Slattys dy lhiassaghey ny Lattysyn ny Whaiylyn Beggey as Briwnys Giar=

English: THIS Act makes provision for the enforcement of summary orders (other than for the payment of money) and for the punishment of persons making default in complying with an order of a Court of Summary Jurisdiction.
Manx: T’AN Slattys shoh jannoo kiarail rolaue son chur ayns bree oardrailyn giare (elley ny son geeck jeh argid) as son kerraghey jeh persoonyn jannoo lheamys ayns choardail rish yn oardyr jeh Quaiyl Briwnys Giare.

English: The Royal assent to this Act was given by His Majesty in Council, at the Court at Buckingham Palace, on the 29th day of May, 1905.
Manx: Va;n coardail Reeoil gys yn Slattys shoh currit liorish E Ard Ooashley ayns Coonseil, ec y Quaiyl ec y Plaase Buckingham, er y nuyoo as feed laa, jeh yn queiggoo vee, nuy cheead yeig as queig (1905).

English: THE MARRIED WOMEN’S PROTECTION AMENDMENT ACT, 1905.
Manx: SLATTYS DY CHOADEY MRAANE POOST, NUY CHEEAD YEIG AS QUEIG (1905).

English: An Act to amend the Married Women’s Protection Act. 1897.
Manx: Slattys dy lhiassaghey Slattys dy Choadey Mraane Poost, hoght cheead yeig as kiare feed as shiaght jeig (1897).

English: SECTION 2 of this Act provides that any husband who has made default in the payment of any weekly sum payable by him under an order made in terms of section 4 of the Act of 1897 may be brought before a Court of Summary Jurisdiction, and that such Court may, on being satisfied of the default, order the husband to be imprisoned with or without hard labour.
Manx: Ayrn jees jeh yn Slattys shoh kiarail dooinney poost erbee ta er ve lheamys ayns geeck jeh sym erbee cour y shiaghtin lhiastynagh fo oadyr jeant coardail lesh ayrn kiare jeh’n Slattys hoght cheead yeig as kiare feed as shiaght jeig (1897) foddee ve currit lesh roish Quaiyl jeh Briwnys Giare, as foddee lheid y Quaiyl, er ve jeant magh jeh yn lheamys, oardyr yn sheshey ve er ny prisooney marish ny fegooish doccar creoi.

English: Section 3 provides that, in case of default of payment of costs the person making default may be imprisoned.
Manx: Ayrn three kiarail, ayns cooish lheamys jeh geeck argid baarit, yn persoon jannoo lheamys oddys ve phrissoonit.

English: The Royal assent to this Act was given by His Majesty in Council, at the Court at Buckingham Palace, on the 29th day of May, 1905.
Manx: Va’n coardail Reeoil gys yn Slattys shoh currit liorish E Ard Ooashley ayns Coonseil, ec y Quaiyl ec y Plaase Buckingham, er y nuyoo as feed laa, jeh yn queiggoo vee, nuy cheead yeig as queig (1905).
